p: Large red‐listed bird species have increased as a consequence of conservation actions, decrease in pesticides (particularly birds of prey), and decrease in persecution. At the European scale, particularly large and rare species have increased largely due to conservation actions while the more common and smaller species have declined considerably (Inger et al., 2015). However, for most species, climate change and land use probably are the key factors affecting population change and range shift patterns (Fraixedas, Lindén, & Lehikoinen, 2015; Virkkala, 2016; Virkkala & Lehikoinen, 2014).
